comments.raw_text: totalPeriodBytes and totalPeriodBytesTCP are declared static (ie. global) but not protected by a lock when they are incremented. This is a bug in selfserv.c

comments.text: Also I noticed that in strsclnt, -s option in doesn't work if -f  filename is also provided (with selfserv as server).
